name: Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites Washington DC-Northeast

reviews.text: Flew in from LAX having stayed at HI X the night before. As expected, cookie cut mould except this one has a heated indoor (albeit heavily chrorinated pool). Room is very cleanas expected as with other HI X but pillows are again too soft.
reviews.title: A bit too far from the sights !!

reviews.text: Breakfast is as expected bland with powdered omelette but here at least they have yogurt, bananas and bagels.Coffee in brewer in room is too weak for my liking.
reviews.title: Hospital Hospitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Whilst no complaints about cleanliness and smartness of hotel, the distance from DC heart is a negative (i had to pay $18m to get here from downtown). Other negatives it is next to a busy highway and with only fast food joints (KFC and similar) you are stranded without a car and it is too far to go downtown for your dinner if you have come back in the afternoon.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, but not again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Another downside is the price and this is post cherry season and my last minute booking costs $200 and if i booked earlier i would find decent 3 star hotels downtown close to eating establishments. So unless you have a got a car or intend to come back to hotel only to sleep after a day's walk, HI X WA is really considered outskirt cut out from civilisation unless you ride the shuttle which some has described as erratic. I would not lay blame on drive so quickly as it is fair way downtown,
reviews.title: Nice, But Not So Close
Clean Place Except Pool
reviews.text: I got my shuttle to Union Station next morning within 15 mins so it is handy if you are headed out to catch an AMTRAK the next morning.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The place seems new, the area is a bit busy and a car is a plus in the area. There is a fee for parking per day, around $15. The rooms were nice and if you do get an upgrade the suites are large with a couch and two tv's flat screen. The pool was freezing cold and the hot tub looked ok, we didn't use these, we were told by a maintenance man that we could use the facilities next door I believe it was the Fairfield Inn by Marriott. The pool was small but really warm and the hot tub was almost unbearably HOT which was fine with us, and the area was never crowded. The breakfast was good and varied and complimentary. They even kept it going after stated hours due to the high volume of guests. We forgot a good pillow of ours on the bed and called about it and the AMAZING front desk lady I believe her name was Tiara was AWESOME, we had it the next afternoon via UPS which was fantastic and my husband is once again reunited and snoring on it as review,is being written.
reviews.title: The staff makes this hotel fantastic!!!!!

reviews.text: The whole experience was really wonderful all except the little glitch of head housekeeping who showed up with a clipboard knocking on our door at intervals after 11:45 asking if we were leaving, although we had late checkout at 2 so we felt forced to leave early. This happened to our friends in another room also. Understandably the cleaning woman with her must've wanted to be done and go home, but.....meanwhile management had no issues with us staying and never rushed us.
reviews.title: Had a nice stay

reviews.text: KFC was across the street which was busy but negotiable. There is a gas station with emergency snacks etc in parking lot a short walk away. BTW the hotel lobby has some light fare such as ice cream and frozen dinners and beer for a price $$$ . Don't look for beer at gas stations in DC and late Sunday. All in all nice experience and good people.
reviews.title: Ok for business might be better for tourist

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The neighborhood doesn't look all that great but this hotel and the one next to it (forgot the name) are very nice looking and kept up. Everyone that we came in contact with was pleasant. I didn't take the shuttle because we had a rental car but it didn't take long to get to downtown. Slightly difficult to get in and out of because the way the streets are laid out. You get out on the main street and you can't turn left towards downtown so you have to go the other way up the hill and over a few streets. Check your GPS before leaving the property.
reviews.title: Trip to Washington D.C.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I just stayed at this hotel for business. I had meetings near The Mint building and this hotel is not the best place if you are traveling for business. Let me discuss the good parts of this hotel. The staff was very friendly and they were good hosts. The room was spacious and clean. The workout room was nice sized and the mounted TV's were good quality. The pool area was very clean and although I did not swim I watched other adults swim while I was working out. FYI- there is a glass wall between the workout room and the pool area. The main breakfast/sitting area was clean and nice. The breakfast was the typical standard HIE that is at all locations.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but difficult to get to town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived at 3p.m. our room was not ready. We had asked for a room facing the rear as told by TA. At the front desk they told us that was not neccesary because " there was nothing going on outside so it would be quiet" We waited an hour and went back the room still was not ready,We finally got a room at the front of the hotel! The traffic kept us awake at night. It was very busy at the front desk all the time. Too few people for all the guests.That said, the room was large, two beds, a mini kithchen with sink and microwave, bathroom with all the extra's. A couch and two t.v.'s Outside a MC donalds, KFC, dunkin dounuts and gas stations to buy stuff. We walked outside and were not worried at all. We reserved the shuttle every day and went to Union Station and were picked up there.Breakfast was great, with hot and cold foods, juice and milk and fruit. We would stay there again.
reviews.title: Hotel stay in D.C.

reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: It's ok...wouldn't stay here again though...

reviews.text: Hotel itself is very nice and clean. Staff were very friendly.
reviews.title: Great stay for a good price

reviews.text: Cons:
reviews.title: Still a great place to stay

reviews.text: I was afraid to walk in the area alone. There was an HBO pamphlet in the room but no HBO. There were no blackout curtains...just a thin white curtain...there are tons of lights outside, so it's very bright when you're trying to sleep.
reviews.title: Return Stay and Will Return Again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I arrived at 5:30am after driving up from Florida the whole night. We asked the front desk if there were any rooms available and if we would be able to check in early. Luckily, Kevin was able to accomodate us into a double room without having to sleep in the car until check in at 3pm. As soon as we got our things in the room, we headed downstairs for breakfast (which is included) and served between 6-9am during the week. There is a free shuttle that takes you to Metro Station and also picks you up from 5-10pm. The rooms are very clean and the staff was very informative and helpful. I would definitely be staying here again next year for the Cherry Blossom Festival.
reviews.title: Great Experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was very busy - especially breakfast but we were always able to get to the food and there was always plenty of it. The woman overseeing breakfast was so friendly and efficient. We were on the first floor across from the stairway and the door was so loud it often disturbed our sleep. The pool was also closed Sunday night for 3 hours for a private party. The location was good though and the room was clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: Solid hotel experience

reviews.text: This is a good value hotel, clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.text: I had no car on Washington, and the hotel is not really near the metro. However, they run a very good (and free shuttle service) that runs into Union Station once and hour in the morning and every 30 minutes in the evening until 10.45 (I think). This is a really useful servcie.
reviews.title: Pleasant experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The area around the hotel is a bit desolate with no food shops or restaurants other then garage shops and burger/pizza/taco places.
reviews.title: WORST Customer Service at an IHG in the DC Metro Area

aka: Holiday Inn Express Hotel And Suites Washington Dc-Northeast
description: Enjoy our Northeast Washington, DC Hotel Near the Capitol Building The Holiday Inn Express Hotel and Suites of Northeast Washington is near many hot spots for DC visitors. Ronald Reagan National Airport (DCA) is less than 10 miles away, Union Station and New York Ave Metro are within 2 miles, giving travelers easy access to our hotel. Travelers can immerse themselves in history while visiting the 19 museums of the Smithsonian Institute or popular, downtown Washington, DC memorials. You can escape to the beautiful outdoors when you visit the National Arboretum just beyond your DC hotel room. The close proximity of our Washington, DC hotel to local businesses and government offices makes the commute easy for business travelers. You'll find the Washington Times, the FBI and both Georgetown and George Washington universities within just five miles of our hotel in Washington. In addition, our 900 square feet of meeting space and a 24-hour business center can help you host a conference during your stay. Our hotel rooms overlooking DC offer entertainment for the whole family with free high-speed, wired and wireless Internet access in every room. Unwind anytime in the 24-hour fitness center, indoor heated pool or whirlpool. For a complimentary hot breakfast and a convenient stay, choose this Washington, DC hotel.
